Here's what a JavaScript equivalent for PHPâ€™s array_chunk might look like

{% highlight javascript %}
function hexdec (hex_string) {
  //  discuss at: http://phpjs.org/functions/hexdec/
  // original by: Philippe Baumann
  //   example 1: hexdec('that');
  //   returns 1: 10
  //   example 2: hexdec('a0');
  //   returns 2: 160

  hex_string = (hex_string + '')
    .replace(/[^a-f0-9]/gi, '')
  return parseInt(hex_string, 16)
}

{% endhighlight %}

## Example 1

{% highlight javascript %}
hexdec('that');
{% endhighlight %}

Should return

{% highlight javascript %}
hexdec('that');{% endhighlight %}

## Example 2

{% highlight javascript %}
hexdec('a0');
{% endhighlight %}

Should return

{% highlight javascript %}
hexdec('a0');{% endhighlight %}
